title: 2 John and 3 John: Truth in Community
objective: Practice hospitality, discernment, and faithful leadership shaped by truth and love.

required_passages.text: Walk in truth... watch yourselves... do not receive false teachers... Beloved, do not imitate evil but imitate good... I have no greater joy than to hear that my children are walking in the truth.

segments.audio_script: John's shortest letters show truth and love worked out in church life.

Listen to 2 John and 3 John. In 2 John, believers are urged to walk in truth and love while refusing partnership with false teachers who deny Christ. In 3 John, John commends Gaius for faithful hospitality toward gospel workers and rebukes Diotrephes for prideful control. He encourages imitation of good and joyful commitment to truth.
House-church networks depended on itinerant teachers and relational trust, making discernment and hospitality crucial.
Christian love is not indiscriminate approval; it is truth-shaped faithfulness. Healthy leadership serves mission and welcomes faithful workers rather than seeking status.
Key themes include truth-love integration, discernment, hospitality, leadership integrity, and shared mission.
Reflect on this: Are you supporting truth faithfully while resisting harmful teaching and toxic leadership patterns?
Truth and love must govern every relationship. Next, Revelation reveals the risen Christ among His churches.
